Text:
Several days have passed since Valentine's Day.
Lambda and the Numbers are gathered in the
kitchen with Alpha.

Never thought I'd see this group assembled in
a kitchen, of all places...

Sorry, Lambda, but when I mentioned that you helped
me make the chocolates, everyone started to say that
they wanted to try some.

Those chocolates managed to satisfy even Master
Shadow, so I can understand why.

Except this time you'll be taking center stage
instead of just helping Lady Alpha, right?
That's a lot of responsibility.

Yeah, but won't this just be the same chocolate as
before? If there's no change in the process, it
shouldn't be that hard, no?

You're too naïve. And I can see you know nothing
about making sweets.

Unlike with normal cooking, the key to making sweets
is precise measurements. Thus you can never afford to
let your guard down, no matter how many times you've
made it.

That's true. You must follow the recipe down to the
last grain of sugar, yes?

Correct. The quantities decided by skilled
confectioners are law.

I have to say, I never thought I'd hear you of all
people saying anything like that.
Oh really? Are you calling me dramatic?
No. I think it's more that we're impressed.

Yeah. I've got nothing but respect for you for being
able to both cook and do something as detailed as
make sweets.

It all ties into the skills I learned in the military,
such as nutritional management and survival
cooking.

But, I did memorize a few new things for the
chocolate we'll be making today.

Still, it takes real ability to put knowledge you
just acquired to use so quickly...

You are both a hard worker and flexible enough to
employ new learning. The Garden is fortunate to have
someone of your caliber as our drill instructor.

You honor me. However, I do not consider this to be
truly hard work.

No need to be so modest, is there? That chocolate
was in fact delicious, and it's no lie that you're a
great cook.
B-But...

Now that you mention it...I did have a chance to
taste your cooking back when I was a recruit.

I think it was when I collapsed during training. When
I woke up, there was this tasty-looking meal sitting
next to my bed—
Hey! Don't go dredging up the past like that!

I had no idea... Hehe, now I'd like to try your
cooking too. I'm sure all of your food is flavored
with love.
N-Not you, too, Lady Alpha...! Enough, please!

But you should be proud of your abilities. And don't
worry, even Epsilon approves.

W-With all due respect, Lady Alpha! I am both honored
and delighted by your kind words...but you are too
lavish with your praise!

Hehe, oh, it can't hurt every so often. I know how
diligent you always are, but I rarely get to commend
you for it face to face like this.

And there is still plenty more I want to say.
For instance...your outfit today suits you well.
What?!

I was just thinking the same thing. She's showing off
a cute side that we don't see normally.

I knew you'd get it, Chi. Our Lambda is actually
quite adorable.

She just hides it in front the recruits. But when
it's just us, sometimes she shows little glimpses—

That's enough, all of you! You're taking this
too far!
Uh-oh. Looks like we laid it on a little too thick.
Seems I misread my cue to quit.

Yes, you did get carried away. Even if Lambda is
incredibly cute.

Lady Alpha, you're taking it further than any of
us... I can understand why, though.
Wh-Why, you...! Enough is enough!!!

The kitchen echoes with the angry shouts of Lambda,
her face blushed red at being deemed "cute"—
